spell_miracle_exchange_gold_for_grace_Lo: Offer gold in the hope that the Divine will look favorably upon you.
spell_miracle_revive_full_LocalizationDe: Reaching inwards, down towards the Veil, you try to wrestle them back from the cold grip of death.
spell_miracle_summon_corpse_Localization: To each mind, one body, restoring order to nature.
spell_miracle_summon_corpse_party_Locali: You draw on the affinity towards your fellow travelers and bring them to safety.
spell_miracle_teleport_lyonesse_Localiza: The long road to glory? Or will it be a short path to doom? Prepare well and prosper!
spell_miracle_teleport_petra_dei_Localiz: These mysterious roads that remain since the reign of the papacy may still be traversed.
spell_miracle_teleport_province_Localiza: The rediscovered powers invested in the stones laid down and blessed by Armozel himself.
spell_protective_stance_LocalizationDesc: Increases all physical defenses by <bold>{SlashingPhysicalResistance}</> for <bold>{Duration}</>. Protects the next <bold>{NumStacks}</> instances of damage. Reduces mobility for the duration. Can be turned off by activating again.
spell_pull_aoe_LocalizationDescriptionKe: Deal<damage>{TotalDamage} damage</>to all enemies within <bold>{AoeRadius}</>and pull them to you.
spell_pull_target_LocalizationDescriptio: Pull an enemy to you and cause them to become <bold>chained</> for {Duration}.
spell_purge_target_LocalizationDescripti: Remove all positive effects from an enemy.
spell_push_aoe_LocalizationDescriptionKe: Deal{TotalDamage} damage to all enemies within{AoeRadius}and launch them{PushRange}away from you.
spell_push_target_LocalizationDescriptio: Deal<damage>{TotalDamage} damage</> and launch a single target<bold>{PushRange}</>away from you.
spell_quickremedy_LocalizationDescriptio: Increases healing received by 25% for 10 seconds. Heal yourself and allies in close proximity by <heal>{Health} health</>.
spell_rage_LocalizationDescriptionKey: When active gain <bold>{PhysicalDamageModifier}%</> damage bonus and <bold>{CrowdControlOnNpcModifier}%</> crowd control effectiveness every time you take damage. Effect stacks up to <bold>{NumStacks}</> times.
spell_rallyingbanner_LocalizationDescrip: Call down a battle standard that stuns enemies on landing. The flag motivates allies, increasing their attack speed by <bold>{MeleeAttackSpeedModifier}%</> while in its proximity. The flag disappears after <bold>{GroundDuration}</>.
spell_rebound_LocalizationDescriptionKey: While active, any melee damage received will refresh all of your ability cooldowns. Can only activate once.
spell_replenish_target_01_LocalizationDe: Replenish <bold>{Stamina} stamina</> of a non-hostile target.
spell_revive_LocalizationDescriptionKey: Reaching inwards, down towards the Veil, you try to wrestle them back from the cold grip of death.
spell_root_projectile_LocalizationDescri: Throw a net forward that roots the first enemy hit for <bold>{Duration}</>.
spell_snare_dot_ground_LocalizationDescr: Throw a flask that splashes on impact, reducing the movement speed of affected enemies by <bold>{MovementSpeedModifier}%</> and reduces physical damage dealt by <bold>{PhysicalDamageModifier}%</>. Lasts for <bold>{Duration}</>.
spell_summon_corpse_LocalizationDescript: To each mind, one body, restoring order to nature.
spell_summon_corpse_party_LocalizationDe: You draw on the affinity towards your fellow travelers and bring them to safety.
spell_taunt_LocalizationDescriptionKey: Taunts an enemy forcing them to attack you for a while. Additionally target's damage is reduced by <bold>{PhysicalDamageModifier}%</> for <bold>{Duration}</>.
spell_taunt_sot_aoe_cone_01_Localization: Generates threat towards all enemies in a cone in front of you. Gain stamina over time based on how many enemies were affected. This is the lowest known rank of this spell.
spell_taunt_sot_aoe_cone_02_Localization: Generates threat towards all enemies in a cone in front of you. Gain stamina over time based on how many enemies were affected.
spell_taunt_sot_aoe_cone_03_Localization: Generates threat towards all enemies in a cone in front of you. Gain stamina over time based on how many enemies were affected. This is the highest rank of this spell that is currently known.
spell_teleport_home_LocalizationDescript: The mystical roads that remain since the reign of the papacy may still be traversed.
spell_vital_aura_LocalizationDescription: Grants allies in radius with <heal>+{PseudoMaxHealth} maximum health</> for {Duration}. Additionally allies in close proximity to you will get <bold>{HealingReceivedModifier}% increased healing received</> while the effect is active.
spell_vulnerable_target_LocalizationDesc: Marks an enemy for <bold>{Duration}</> increasing all damage they take by <bold>{DamageTakenModifier}%</>. Killing the marked target grants the killer with increased movement speed for a duration.
treetype_Alpine_Juniper_Tree_Large_01_Lo: Hard and tough, the juniper only lacks the sense of growing straight, to become the builders favorite tree.
The almost colorless smoke of burning juniper was said to drive evil spirits away.
treetype_Beech_Common_Old_01_Inner_Local: Known for its hardwood and rustling foliage, the beech is thought to symbolize the feminine and written knowledge.
Stories say that druids sometimes made their home in old beech forests.
treetype_Beech_Common_Old_01_Outer_Local: Known for its hardwood and rustling foliage, the beech is thought to symbolize the feminine and written knowledge.
You recall that in ancient times, beech trees were called "fays".
treetype_Beech_Common_Old_02_Inner_Local: Known for its hardwood and rustling foliage, the beech is thought to symbolize the feminine and written knowledge.
This imposing giant of the woods makes you wonder if this very Beech Queen is the mythical consort to the Oak King?
treetype_Beech_Common_Old_02_Outer_Local: Known for its hardwood and rustling foliage, the beech is thought to symbolize the feminine and written knowledge.
You have heard somewhere that in old Gallian dialects, beech trees are still called "fays".
treetype_Birch_Adult_01_Outer_Localizati: With its strength and shedding bark, the birch symbolizes fertility, growth, renewal and beauty.
You recall having heard that animals herded with birch sticks become fertile and have healthy offspring.
treetype_Birch_Adult_02_Outer_Localizati: With its strength and shedding bark, the birch symbolizes fertility, growth, renewal and beauty.
As pagan lore would have it, the birch is associated with the land of the dead, death itself and returning from the grave.
treetype_DeathTree_Adult_01_Localization: Windswept, dried out and withering, this tree has seen better days.
treetype_DeathTree_Adult_02_Localization: Windswept, dried out and withering, this tree has seen better days.
treetype_Eerie_Pine_Old_01_Inner_Localiz: Similar to its cousin the Silver Fir, the Gloomy Pine somehow manages to bring a light of hope to this place.
You recall stories of dryads from the Fay realm gathering and transform into Pines to escape the eye of God.
treetype_Eerie_Pine_Old_01_Outer_Localiz: Similar to its cousin the Silver Fir, the Gloomy Pine somehow manages to bring a light of hope to this place.
In this place where the edges and contours of the world seem unclear, the pine's alleged connection with dreams becomes obvious.
treetype_Eerie_Pine_Old_02_Inner_Localiz: Similar to its cousin the Silver Fir, the Gloomy Pine somehow manages to bring a light of hope to this place.
You have heard that some of these gloomy pines may mark the burial sites of heroes of old.
treetype_Eerie_Pine_Old_02_Outer_Localiz: Similar to its cousin the Silver Fir, the Gloomy Pine somehow manages to bring a light of hope to this place.
You recall stories of dryads from the Fay realm emerging from these old pines to torment lost travelers.
treetype_Hawthorn_Tree_Haunted_Large_01_: It is universally considered bad luck cutting down a Hawthorn.
You recall old children stories describing old Hawthorns as gateways to wonderous, enchanted worlds.
treetype_Hawthorn_Tree_Haunted_Medium_01: It is universally considered bad luck cutting down a Hawthorn.
You recall old children stories describing old Hawthorns as gateways to the gates of Hell.
treetype_Hawthorn_Tree_Large_01_Localiza: It is universally considered bad luck cutting down a Hawthorn.
Ancient Hawthorn trees are by some, believed to have grown and endured in response to a holy person performing their magic.
treetype_Hawthorn_Tree_Medium_01_Localiz: It is universally considered bad luck cutting down a Hawthorn.
No trees are as connected to stories of the Fay, as the Hawthorn
treetype_Legendary_Tree_Adult_01_Localiz: Fay-touched for some, cursed for others... Rare are the woodmen who dare fell a Wisptree.
treetype_Legendary_Tree_Young_01_Localiz: Fay-touched for some, cursed for others, rare are the woodmen who dare chopping wisptree down.
treetype_Oak_Common_Old_01_Inner_Localiz: Known for its longevity and ability to withstand hardship, the oak symbolizes wisdom and endurance.
It is said that all false Gods end their days buried under an oak.
treetype_Oak_Common_Old_01_Outer_Localiz: Known for its longevity and ability to withstand hardship, the oak symbolizes wisdom and endurance.
You recall having heard of ancient and revered oaks being given names as the enduring landmarks they are.
treetype_Oak_Common_Old_02_Inner_Localiz: Known for its longevity and ability to withstand hardship, the oak symbolizes wisdom and endurance.
You wonder if this old and mighty tree was ever given a name by someone who's life it touched.
treetype_Oak_Common_Old_02_Outer_Localiz: Known for its longevity and ability to withstand hardship, the oak symbolizes wisdom and endurance.
If the oak king loves the sound of leaves rustling in the wind, there is little wrong with the forest.
treetype_Oak_Haunted_Adult_01_Inner_Loca: Known for its longevity and ability to withstand hardship, the oak symbolizes wisdom and endurance.
It is said that the Oak is tied to wisdom and old knowledge. You shudder at the thought of what this twisted tree has seen.
treetype_Oak_Haunted_Adult_01_Localizati: Known for its longevity and ability to withstand hardship, the oak symbolizes wisdom and endurance.
Acorns and oakleaves have always had strong relation to heroism in battle, symbolizing strength and endurance.
treetype_Oak_Haunted_Adult_02_Inner_Loca: Known for its longevity and ability to withstand hardship, the oak symbolizes wisdom and endurance.
You recall that in ancient texts, the same word "duir" is sometimes used for both "oak" and "door".
treetype_Oak_Haunted_Adult_02_Localizati: Known for its longevity and ability to withstand hardship, the oak symbolizes wisdom and endurance.
It is said that to all pagan gods who controlled thunder and lightning, the oak was considered sacred.
treetype_Silver_Fir_Old_01_Inner_Localiz: Staying green throughout even the hardest winters, the Fir symbolizes energy of resistance and the light of hope.
It is said that the Druids of old celebrated winter solstice under the branches of the Silver Fir.
treetype_Silver_Fir_Old_01_Outer_Localiz: Staying green throughout even the hardest winters, the Fir symbolizes energy of resistance and the light of hope.
You recall saintly tales of pagan deities being imprisoned in large fir trees. What if...
treetype_Silver_Fir_Old_02_Inner_Localiz: Staying green throughout even the hardest winters, the Fir symbolizes energy of resistance and the light of hope.
It strikes you that the "silver" it its name may indicate a connection to stories of Meirothea, the second redeemer.
treetype_Silver_Fir_Old_02_Outer_Localiz: Staying green throughout even the hardest winters, the Fir symbolizes energy of resistance and the light of hope.
In some parts of Gallia, in the darkest days of winter, it is tradition to bring a young fir tree and branches into the home, as a reminder of the coming spring.
wearable_back_cloth_capehood_01_founders: These threads are alive with the flickering flames of creation.
wearable_back_cloth_rp_capehood_01_brigh: Green and crimson cloth worked with winged figures from half-forgotten tales. To some it whispers of the Fays and the promise of renewal; to others, it is a perilous symbol, fit to draw the eye of the Inquisition.
wearable_back_cloth_rp_capehood_01_class: Woven in gold with radiant geometry, the cloak bears devotion to the Divine. Its brilliance graces both sacred rites and learned courts.
wearable_back_cloth_rp_capehood_01_plain: A simple, unadorned cloak of sturdy cloth. Worn by those who seek no splendor, only shelter from wind and rain.
wearable_back_cloth_rp_capehood_01_sombe: Dark blue drapery embroidered with roses, veiled in shadowed elegance. Worn in twilight courts, where beauty blooms beneath the stars.
wearable_bottom_cloth_pants_03_foundersp: These threads reverberate with the silent sounds of the traveler's sophisticated air.
wearable_chainmail_bottom_common_13_Loca: The chains used in this chainmail are heavy and rigid, made with considerable skill and strong tools, lessening the chance of them coming apart at the worst moment.
wearable_chainmail_bottom_common_18_Loca: The rings this chainmail is made from are usually welded together, even though the better quality armors of this type may have some riveted rings mixed in, in places that are potentially under more stress than others.
wearable_chainmail_bottom_common_23_Loca: The rings in this chainmail are of standard size, all are riveted and usually made of steel, making this armor strong and easy to maintain.
